Articles.Content:
Awesome.

Textureless, it kind of reminds me of K7 space station
So the question is, what all does it actually do? Does it bounce? Rupture? Increase drag?

So the question is, what all does it actually do? Does it bounce? Rupture? Increase drag?

It will increase drag, yes. As for bounce, maybe. I dunno if I can make a collider scale and play nice with the rest of the world.

Well, if you can get it to bounce, you could make a bouncy sphere on a .5m package and a bouncy donut on a thin 1m piece. Stick them on each respective end of a command module and you have essentially a pyramidal (actually conical, but close enough) airbag aerobraking and crash absorbing system

Well, if you can get it to bounce, you could make a bouncy sphere on a .5m package and a bouncy donut on a thin 1m piece. Stick them on each respective end of a command module and you have essentially a pyramidal (actually conical, but close enough) airbag aerobraking and crash absorbing system

I was planning on that for probodobodyne actually.
So, a space station pack is coming is it?
Cool inflatable thingy you got!
Silisko, releasing those packs all at once will kill about 1,000 people with its sheer awesomeness.

Silisko, releasing those packs all at once will kill about 1,000 people with its sheer awesomeness.

Thats if you lucky. But seriously, don\'t release them all at the same time, mayby a week apart.
ah thanks god a Bigelow style station needs more detail.
Inflatable module immediately made me think Jeb let a MASSIVE space fart rip!

ah thanks god a Bigelow style station needs more detail.

Yeah, going to unwrap and texture it now.

The 1m docking port is too big for general use, is it okay if I use the Kosmos one for smaller modules? Or even make my own and make an adapter to the Kosmos port for compatibility(hopefully docking ports will have identifiers to allow for different types in the future)

Yeah, going to unwrap and texture it now.

The 1m docking port is too big for general use, is it okay if I use the Kosmos one? Or even make my own and make an adapter to the Kosmos port for compatibility(hopefully docking ports will have identifiers to allow for different types in the future)

UUI is open for all to make adapters for it
Wow. Nova, you are a productively busy guy. I truly thank you for all this awesome stuff you\'ve put into KSP...
Its cause the clutter of 30 or so pages got archieved, so we have all this room now to wiggle and advertise our packs =P

Sorry but I\'ve been out of the loop for a while - I\'ll be honest, I wasn\'t really impressed by the initial decision to work all parts under your \'own rules\' (re: Silisko edition) as this basically makes other part packs somewhat incompatible, and thus has a sort of \'my way or the highway\' feeling. I never used any of them so I can\'t speak for how they really worked out, but *THAT SAID*, is this still true? How \'compatible\' are they with other addons? What about these nifty plugins I hear so much about?

Sorry but I\'ve been out of the loop for a while - I\'ll be honest, I wasn\'t really impressed by the initial decision to work all parts under your \'own rules\' (re: Silisko edition) as this basically makes other part packs somewhat incompatible, and thus has a sort of \'my way or the highway\' feeling. I never used any of them so I can\'t speak for how they really worked out, but *THAT SAID*, is this still true? How \'compatible\' are they with other addons? What about these nifty plugins I hear so much about?

The current ones in the SE2 alpha are a far less drastic change - you can use them with vanilla parts, but just be aware it won\'t work as well as it could.

The current ones in the SE2 alpha are a far less drastic change - you can use them with vanilla parts, but just be aware it won\'t work as well as it could.

Good to hear, thanks - wasn\'t really specified on the first post, just a dropbox link

Probably going to wait a couple days for 0.14.2 to come out and break all the addons before I get too attached to them
Few texture stretching issues I have to take care of but I thought it was presentable.

I really love your parts, but it seems sort of silly to tease us all for these last few weeks with all sorts of packs and plugins in development and seemingly switching from project to project while not releasing any of them.

I really love your parts, but it seems sort of silly to tease us all for these last few weeks with all sorts of packs and plugins in development and seemingly switching from project to project while not releasing any of them.

Sometimes I worry that I have some form of ADD. I just can\'t keep my interest solely on one thing at a time...

Sometimes I worry that I have some form of ADD. I just can\'t keep my interest solely on one thing at a time...

I know the feeling. With the amount of work you put into these packs it is understandable that you want them to be perfect and it would be wrong of us as members of the community to ask you to lower your standards to push out a complete back that isn\'t how you want it yet. However all this cool stuff floating above our heads that we just can\'t reach yet is kinda nerve wrecking. It\'s like dangling steak over a dog. So keep up the amazing work and , quoting Cave Johnson on this, 'Don\'t release it into the world until it\'s good and damn ready' because we only have so many clones of Jeb and cloning is expensive! ;P
That\'s pretty awesome, Nova. Hopefully you can figure the collision meshes out for airbags.
For a second I thought that picture was a propane tank.
